page.title: 06THE HARRY CARLTON SCHOOL
page.content: The Harry Carlton School was built as a Secondary Modern School to cater for children up to the age of fifteen. There was a system of 11+selection and those pupils who achieved the necessary standard attended grammar school at West Bridgford,just south of Nottingham. Because of the reorganisation of secondary schooling in Notts.and the growth of the village,it became a Comprehensive School in 1970.It now serves,not only E.Leake, but the surrounding villages of Sutton Bonnington,Costock,Gotham,Normanton,an d Rempstone. The school has sixth form facilities and is noted for its modern lower form unit. Its examination results are amongst the highest in the authority.
